intro: Oxalis yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces edible, sour-tasting berries that are sometimes used in local cuisine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Oxalis yucatanensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
